Celebrating the Accomplishments of our Kindergarten Students

Since we cannot have our traditional kindergarten graduation we will be holding a social distancing graduation for our students outside. The graduation will be on Friday, June 19th at 10:00 AM. Due to social distancing, we ask that you keep your guests limited to immediate family.

We ask that you form a line in the loop and stay in your vehicle until your child is called upon. If the line is backed up, we ask that you park in the school’s parking a lot while you wait for the line to go down.

Once your child is called you may all exit the vehicle to take photos in front of the graduation arch and receive their graduation gift. You will be in charge of taking your child’s pictures in front of the arch. Once your child receives their gift, you’ll be asked to head back to your vehicle and from there you may enjoy the rest of graduation day. We must do this in a timely manner in order to get through all 50 graduates and respect the rules of social distancing.

Buffalo Police Department Lieutenant Tommy Champion (a mentor at CSI and co-moderator the CSI Young Gentlemen's Club) helped organize a fund drive to help the CSI family that lost their home last month to a house fire.

A CSI fourth grade student's home caught on fire the night of March 6th. The student smelled smoke and alerted his family to get them out of the house safely, even rescuing his two dogs and instructing his mother to move the car away from the windows of the house.

Upon hearing about the incident, BPD C district Chief, Al Wright, and Lieutenant Tommy Champion were able to coordinate a drive to help the family. C district along, with other BPD officers, a New York State court officer, and the family and friends of officers raised $1,250.00 for the child and his family to assist them through this difficult time.

Thanks go out to Lieutenant Tommy Champion, Chief Al Wright, and the officers of C District for coordinating this fund drive, and to everyone who contributed.

CSI Student a Genuine Hero

On the morning of March 6, one of our families experienced a devastating house fire. Our fourth grade student is credited for smelling smoke and awakening his entire family, which ensured that everyone got out of the house safely. He even rescued their two dogs, and had the presence of mind to tell his mother to move the car away from the house as windows were blowing out. We are heartbroken over the family's loss, but we are also very proud of our student and his courage.
